item.title: 投资者押注全球需求增长，铜价逼近 10,000 美元
item.description: 全球经济复苏将提升对工业材料的需求，这一预期推动了铜价在 4 月份的上涨，之后铜价一度逼近每吨 10,000 美元。【原文：Copper edged closer to $10,000 a ton after an April rally fueled by bets that a recovering global economy will lift demand for industrial materials.】

item.title: 罢工后中东紧张局势缓和，黄金出现回调
item.description: 由于中东地缘政治紧张局势缓解，避险需求减少，交易员们期待着将揭示货币政策前景的美国数据，因此黄金走低。【原文：Gold edged lower as geopolitical tensions eased in the Middle East, paring haven demand, and traders looked ahead to US data that will shed light on the outlook for monetary policy.】

item.title: 中国地产大亨面临逾期贷款付款要求
item.description: 一位在香港和伦敦抢购豪宅和写字楼的中国富豪面临银行要求偿还 2 亿多美元贷款的要求，而他和他的家人为这些贷款提供了个人担保，这表明这位商人和他的房地产投资公司面临进一步的流动性问题。【原文：A Chinese tycoon who had snapped up mansions and offices in Hong Kong and London faces demands from banks to repay more than $200 million of loans for which he and his family had provided personal guarantees, in a sign of further liquidity problems for the businessman and his property-investment company.】

item.title: 本田即将与加拿大达成协议提升电动汽车产能
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，加拿大即将与本田汽车公司达成协议，日本公司将在安大略省生产电动汽车及其零部件。【原文：Canada is on the verge of an agreement with Honda Motor Co. that would see the Japanese firm build electric vehicles and their components in the province of Ontario, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 安联称日本股市将战胜地缘政治和日元波动
item.description: 中东紧张局势和货币波动导致日本创纪录的股票涨势出现动摇，但由于稳固的企业基本面和人工智能的长期前景提供了支撑，这种疲软看起来只是暂时的。【原文：Middle East tensions and currency volatility have caused Japan’s record stock rally to falter, but the weakness looks temporary as solid corporate fundamentals and the long-term artificial intelligence outlook provide support.】

item.title: 法国巴黎银行招聘 30 名员工建立新的中国证券部门
item.description: 法国巴黎银行（BNP Paribas SA）已聘请近 30 人在中国开展证券业务，熟悉内情的人士称，法国巴黎银行在 17 年前退出当地合资企业后重新进入中国市场。【原文：BNP Paribas SA has hired close to 30 people to launch its securities operation in China, re-entering the market after exiting a local joint venture 17 years ago, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 美元的长期统治为市场敲响了警钟
item.description: 全球金融市场正在遭遇一股他们没有预料到会在 2024 年出现的力量：强势美元卷土重来，而且似乎将继续存在。【原文：The world’s financial markets are encountering a force they didn’t bet on for 2024: A strong dollar is back and looks set to stay.】

item.title: S&P 500 将从强劲收益中找回魔力
item.description:
由于债券收益率飙升，指数在经历了年初的火爆之后陷入困境，自3月份创纪录以来一路下滑

。【原文：

Index is struggling after hot start to year, in a rout since March record as bond yields are soaring

】

item.title: 中国经济放缓、高薪令香港银行业面临更多裁员
item.description: 据彭博情报公司（Bloomberg Intelligence）称，由于中国交易持续放缓，雇主希望裁减高薪员工，香港投资银行家可能面临更多裁员。【原文：Hong Kong investment bankers could face more job cuts as the slowdown in China deals persists and employers look to trim highly compensated staff, according to Bloomberg Intelligence.】

item.title: 美国领导的叙利亚联军基地遭来自伊拉克的火箭弹袭击
item.description: 伊拉克政府下属的伊拉克安全媒体小组在一份声明中说，美国领导的打击武装分子联盟在叙利亚的一个军事基地在周日晚些时候遭到火箭弹袭击。【原文：A military base in Syria belonging to a US-led coalition combating militants in the area came under rocket-fire late on Sunday, the government-affiliated Iraqi Security Media Cell said in a statement.】

item.title: 加拿大油砂城附近的野火引发疏散警报
item.description: 加拿大油砂地区的一场 74 英亩（30 公顷）野火引发了该地区最大城市麦克默里堡附近一个社区的疏散警报。【原文：A 74-acre (30—hectare) wildfire in the Canadian oil sands prompted an evacuation alert for a community near Fort McMurray, the biggest city in the region.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 马斯克推迟印度之行。美联储探索新的经济预测方式。比特币 "减半"。以下是您今天需要了解的信息。【原文：Musk postpones his trip to India. The Fed explores a new way of economic forecasting. Bitcoin’s “halving” happens. Here’s what you need to know today.】

item.title: 交易商关注中东风险，石油在周度下跌后回落
item.description: 在中东紧张局势一触即发之际，交易商权衡了伊朗和以色列可能采取的下一步措施，石油价格继今年首次连续一周下跌后出现回落。【原文：Oil fell after its first back-to-back weekly decline this year as traders weighed the potential next steps from Iran and Israel amid simmering tensions in the Middle East.】

item.title: 中国股市暴跌后，经纪人以 40% 的回报率向 "滚雪球 "买家招手
item.description: 中国证券公司正以接近创纪录的高回报吸引投资者重返衍生品市场，今年早些时候的股灾助长了中国股市的暴跌。【原文：Chinese securities firms are dangling near record-high returns to lure investors back into the market for derivatives that fueled the nation’s stock selloff earlier this year, as fallout from the meltdown cuts deeper into their profits from the business.】

item.title: 英国富豪将房产要价提高了 12 个月之最
item.description: 在线销售门户网站 Rightmove 的数据显示，在更多顶级住宅上市的推动下，英国住宅的要价创下了 12 个月以来的最高年度涨幅。【原文：Asking prices for UK homes rose at the highest annual pace in 12 months, driven by more top-of-the-ladder houses coming to market, according to the online sales portal Rightmove.】

item.title: 英国启动沙特投资行动，以分享穆罕默德-苏丹广播公司的愿景
item.description: 英国和沙特阿拉伯将于下月在利雅得举行贸易博览会，届时苏纳克将发起一项投资活动，旨在利用王储穆罕默德-本-萨勒曼的 "2030 愿景 "项目。【原文：The UK and Saudi Arabia will hold a trade expo in Riyadh next month as Rishi Sunak launches an investment drive aimed at taking advantage of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman’s Vision 2030 project.】

item.title: 英国能源账单可能因高利率而增加 290 亿英镑
item.description: 到 2050 年，持续的高利率可能会使英国的能源账单每年增加 290 亿英镑（360 亿美元），因为为使能源系统更加环保而进行的投资将在未来数年内锁定高成本。【原文：Persistently high interest rates could add £29 billion ($36 billion) a year to UK energy bills by 2050, as investments to make the energy system greener lock in high costs for years to come.】

item.title: 市场综述：亚洲交易员等待关键数据；美国期货上涨
item.description: 亚洲市场周一开盘涨跌不一，市场焦点转向本周的一系列公司财报和经济数据，以洞察央行政策的走向。【原文：Asian markets were set for a mixed open Monday as focus shifts to a slew of company earnings and economic data this week for insight into the direction of central bank policy.】

item.title: Galp 表示纳米比亚的莫帕尼可能是重要的商业石油发现
item.description: 葡萄牙石油公司 Galp Energia SGPS SA 表示，油井测试 "有可能 "表明莫帕尼可能是纳米比亚的一个重要商业发现。【原文：Portuguese oil company Galp Energia SGPS SA said a well test “potentially” indicates Mopane could be an important commercial find in Namibia.】

item.title: 中国成为美国大选 "出气筒"，做好最坏打算
item.description: 由于北京已经成为美国大选的首要目标，习近平主席的政府正在抵制任何可能对世界第二大经济体产生反作用的举动。【原文：With Beijing already becoming a top target in the US election campaign, President Xi Jinping’s government is resisting any move that could backfire on the world’s second-largest economy.】

item.title: 法拉奇风波后，Debanking 投诉骤增
item.description: 在上一个纳税年度，英国有关去银行化的投诉量增加了近一半，这凸显了奈杰尔-法拉奇通过对关闭其账户做出愤怒的公开回应，引起了人们对这一话题的兴趣。【原文：The volume of complaints in the UK about debanking increased by almost half in the last tax year, underscoring the interest Nigel Farage has drawn to the topic through his furious public response to the closing of his accounts.】

item.title: 中国泡沫红茶热潮造就六位亿万富翁
item.description:
大受欢迎的饮料销售商正急于套现，但日益激烈的竞争有可能破坏糖水热潮。【原文：

Sellers of the hugely popular drink are rushing to cash in, but increasing competition threatens to spoil the sugar rush.

】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 本周晚些时候，埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil Corp.）、雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp.）和道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies SE）将公布第一季度财报。重型机械制造商卡特彼勒公司（Caterpillar Inc.【原文：Earnings season is in full swing, with Big Oil firms Exxon Mobil Corp., Chevron Corp. and TotalEnergies SE set to post first-quarter results later this week. Heavy-machinery maker Caterpillar Inc. also reports earnings that could shed light on the strength of the mining and construction industries.】

item.title: 债券交易员提心吊胆，等待日本央行发出购买信号
item.description: 本周，日本央行将召开会议，债券交易员们对日本央行改变购买该国主权债务政策的任何暗示都惶恐不安。【原文：Bond traders are on edge heading into the Bank of Japan meeting this week for any hints of change to its policy of purchasing the country’s sovereign debt.】

item.title: 欧洲央行维勒鲁瓦称石油不确定性不会阻止 6 月降息
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（Francois Villeroy de Galhau）表示，欧洲中央银行不会因为油价的不确定性而放弃在 6 月份首次降息。【原文：The European Central Bank won’t be swayed from a first interest-rate cut in June by oil price uncertainty, Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau said.】

item.title: 债券交易商期待创纪录的拍卖，以寻找 5%收益率达到顶峰的迹象
item.description: 随着国债有望在本月创下今年以来最差的表现，大量的拍卖活动迫在眉睫，这将是对收益率在达到 2024 年最高水平后是否已经见顶的重大考验。【原文：With Treasuries on track for their worst month this year, a hefty slate of auctions looms as a major test of whether yields have peaked after reaching the highest levels of 2024.】

item.title: 智利对中国钢铁征收关税以促进当地产业发展
item.description: 智利对该国采矿业使用的中国钢铁产品征收临时反倾销关税，以支持当地濒临倒闭的钢铁厂。【原文：Chile imposed temporary anti-dumping tariffs on Chinese steel products used in the country’s mining industry in a bid to support faltering local mills.】

item.title: 肖尔茨以通胀和就业为由对德国经济持乐观态度
item.description: 德国总理奥拉夫-肖尔茨（Olaf Scholz）对德国的经济前景表示乐观，他提到了创纪录的就业率和因能源成本下降而放缓的通货膨胀率。【原文：German Chancellor Olaf Scholz is optimistic on his country’s economic prospects, citing record employment and slowing inflation thanks to falling energy costs.】

item.title: 戴蒙会见寻求私人资金的开发银行领导人
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.首席执行官杰米-戴蒙（Jamie Dimon）会见了世界银行集团和其他几家多边发展贷款机构的高管，他们正努力将更多的私人资金投入到新兴市场的各项计划中。【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon met with executives from the World Bank Group and several other multilateral development lenders as they seek to pull more private money into initiatives across emerging markets.】

item.title: 美联储的预测方法看起来越来越过时，伯南克提出了替代方案
item.description: 美联储的预测和公众沟通模式看起来越来越有限，尤其是在经济不断带来惊喜的情况下。【原文：The Federal Reserve is stuck in a mode of forecasting and public communication that looks increasingly limited, especially as the economy keeps delivering surprises.】
